title: Collaborative Learning Workshop for Preservice Teachers: Academic Library Information Utilization in Mathematics Education Research (Focus on Equations and Statistics)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience in academic resource retrieval (library catalogs, Google Scholar, etc.) and foundational knowledge of mathematics education research methodologies (defining research questions, setting independent/dependent variables, basic statistical analysis)
context.additional_context: A program for pre-service teachers requiring research methodology skills using academic library databases/e-resources (e.g., JSTOR Math Education Collection, ERIC). Focuses on case studies of math problem-solving strategies (equation-solving algorithms) and educational statistics analysis (descriptive/inferential statistics).

learning_goals: Systematically explore academic resources related to mathematics education topics (e.g., polynomial equation-solving strategies, probability distribution interpretation) using the ICE framework (Idea-Connection-Extension), analyzing graphs and statistical models.

Through collaborative learning, propose ≥2 critical evaluation criteria for academic information validity (e.g., proof feasibility of formulas, derivation processes) and reliability (e.g., data source transparency, sample size adequacy).
Explain a 4+ step research design process (topic selection-variable setting-data collection-statistical analysis) using academic library digital resources (mathematics databases, e-journals).

resources: Open-Access Mathematics Education Research Paper Samples
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
